intro: Streptostigma viridiflorum, commonly known as the green-flowered streptostigma, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in early summer. Its botanical features include a slender, hairy stem and a distinctive root system that helps it thrive in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
